result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Huber granted - AMENDED 04-14-16: Defendant may travel out-of-county for work, specifically to Redgranite, WI (Waushara County); and credit sentence w/1 day of setence credit

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Letter from Atty Frank to Judge dated 04-11-16 requesting Amended JOC
Letter from Sheriff dated 04-11-16 to Atty Frank
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Joshua A. Schmidt in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Frank agrees and asks for the full 60 days to report to jail and states that there would be a read-in on an uncharged case.  Atty Hendee agrees.
Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee will not be filing 15-SO2569 based on the agreement.    State has complied with victim notification requirements and has a victim impact statement that is provided to the court.
Court reads the statement.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments and states that credit will be submitted to the court by stipulation of counsel.  Defendant asks for a payment plan.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before June 3, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-06-2016 11:15 am

Defendant Joshua A. Schmidt in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Frank; the defendant will be going back to the hospital and the parties are unable to proceed today.  Atty Frank agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset per request.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 11:15 am.
